snippet: The audit of almost eight million ballots is part of a deal brokered by Secretary of State John Kerry to ease a dispute between the two candidates.
abstract: Election workers in Afghanistan begin auditing votes cast in country's presidential runoff, monitored by American and United Nations observers; audit is part of deal brokered by Sec of State John Kerry to ease dispute between candidates Abdullah Abdullah and Ashraf Ghani.
lead_paragraph: The audit of almost eight million ballots is part of a deal brokered by Secretary of State John Kerry to ease a dispute between the two candidates.

headline.main: Afghanistan Begins Audit of Presidential Election
headline.print_headline: Afghanistan Begins Audit of Presidential Election
